newsitem.title: USA: Hawkins Chemical sees FY97 EPS at $0.64.
newsitem.headline: Hawkins Chemical sees FY97 EPS at $0.64.

text.p: Hawkins Chemical Inc chief executive officer Dean Hahn said on Wednesday the company's earnings per share for the fiscal year ending in Septebmer will "possibly" be $0.64.

"Earnings per share were at $0.59 (in fiscal 1996). With the five percent stock dividend, we'll pro rate that back to about $0.55. In fiscal 1997 we'll possibly be $0.64, and that's with the increase in shares," Hahn told Reuters after the company's annual shareholders meeting.
Hahn credited much of the anticipated rise in earnings to the chemical supplier's increased reliance upon Cheese-Phos, a proprietary liquid emulsifier used in cheese processing.

The executive said he expected both sales and profits on Cheese-Phos to double in 1997. "We're expecting our Cheese-Phos business to double in both sales and profits (in fiscal 1997). Sales will be around $3.5 million and profits, $1.6 million," he said.
Hahn said by May the company will have installed capital equipment which will reduce the manufacturing time of Cheese-Phos by 80 percent.
He said the company's capital expenditures would decrease this year to about $3 million from $4.3 million in fiscal 1996.
"Capital expenditures this year are going to be down to about $3 million and next year they'll drop off more because we've got all the expansion done at our (storage) terminals."
The company has been expanding its terminal base on the Mississippi River, adding a tank for the storage of caustic soda used in the manufacture of Cheese-Phos.
